aurelienribon.tweenengine

Class Timeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • aurelienribon.tweenengine.BaseTween<Timeline>
      • aurelienribon.tweenengine.Timeline

  • public final class Timeline
extends BaseTween<Timeline>
    A Timeline can be used to create complex animations made of sequences and parallel sets of Tweens.

    The following example will create an animation sequence composed of 5 parts:

    1. First, opacity and scale are set to 0 (with Tween.set() calls).
    2. Then, opacity and scale are animated in parallel.
    3. Then, the animation is paused for 1s.
    4. Then, position is animated to x=100.
    5. Then, rotation is animated to 360Â°.

    This animation will be repeated 5 times, with a 500ms delay between each iteration: 

     
 Timeline.createSequence()
     .push(Tween.set(myObject, OPACITY).target(0))
     .push(Tween.set(myObject, SCALE).target(0, 0))
     .beginParallel()
          .push(Tween.to(myObject, OPACITY, 0.5f).target(1).ease(Quad.INOUT))
          .push(Tween.to(myObject, SCALE, 0.5f).target(1, 1).ease(Quad.INOUT))
     .end()
     .pushPause(1.0f)
     .push(Tween.to(myObject, POSITION_X, 0.5f).target(100).ease(Quad.INOUT))
     .push(Tween.to(myObject, ROTATION, 0.5f).target(360).ease(Quad.INOUT))
     .repeat(5, 0.5f)
     .start(myManager);
    See Also:
    Tween, TweenManager, TweenCallback

    • Method Detail

      • getPoolSize

        public static int getPoolSize()
        Used for debug purpose. Gets the current number of empty timelines that are waiting in the Timeline pool.

      • ensurePoolCapacity

        public static void ensurePoolCapacity(int minCapacity)
        Increases the minimum capacity of the pool. Capacity defaults to 10.

      • createSequence

        public static Timeline createSequence()
        Creates a new timeline with a 'sequence' behavior. Its children will be delayed so that they are triggered one after the other.

      • createParallel

        public static Timeline createParallel()
        Creates a new timeline with a 'parallel' behavior. Its children will be triggered all at once.

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Overrides:
        reset in class BaseTween<Timeline>

      • push

        public Timeline push(Tween tween)
        Adds a Tween to the current timeline.
        Returns:
        The current timeline, for chaining instructions.

      • push

        public Timeline push(Timeline timeline)
        Nests a Timeline in the current one.
        Returns:
        The current timeline, for chaining instructions.

      • pushPause

        public Timeline pushPause(float time)
        Adds a pause to the timeline. The pause may be negative if you want to overlap the preceding and following children.
        Parameters:
        time - A positive or negative duration.
        Returns:
        The current timeline, for chaining instructions.

      • beginSequence

        public Timeline beginSequence()
        Starts a nested timeline with a 'sequence' behavior. Don't forget to call end() to close this nested timeline.
        Returns:
        The current timeline, for chaining instructions.

      • beginParallel

        public Timeline beginParallel()
        Starts a nested timeline with a 'parallel' behavior. Don't forget to call end() to close this nested timeline.
        Returns:
        The current timeline, for chaining instructions.

      • end

        public Timeline end()
        Closes the last nested timeline.
        Returns:
        The current timeline, for chaining instructions.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<BaseTween<?>> getChildren()
        Gets a list of the timeline children. If the timeline is started, the list will be immutable.

      • build

        public Timeline build()
        Description copied from class: BaseTween
        Builds and validates the object. Only needed if you want to finalize a tween or timeline without starting it, since a call to ".start()" also calls this method.
        Overrides:
        build in class BaseTween<Timeline>
        Returns:
        The current object, for chaining instructions.

      • start

        public Timeline start()
        Description copied from class: BaseTween
        Starts or restarts the object unmanaged. You will need to take care of its life-cycle. If you want the tween to be managed for you, use a TweenManager.
        Overrides:
        start in class BaseTween<Timeline>
        Returns:
        The current object, for chaining instructions.

      • free

        public void free()
        Description copied from class: BaseTween
        Stops and resets the tween or timeline, and sends it to its pool, for + * later reuse. Note that if you use a TweenManager, this method + * is automatically called once the animation is finished.
        Overrides:
        free in class BaseTween<Timeline>
